snippet: The campaign to oust Gov. Scott Walker was heavily aided by President Obama’s party, campaign and labor allies, but fell short against an organized, well-funded Republican apparatus.
abstract: Failed attempt to recall Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker offers a glimpse of the financial, economic and organizational dynamics that are already shaping the presidential contest between Pres Obama and Mitt Romney; Walker succeeded largely due to a well-funded national Republican apparatus, but it remains unclear whether the same forces can deliver the state to Romney in November.

byline.contributor: Jeff Zeleny contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The campaign to oust Gov. Scott Walker was heavily aided by President Obama’s party, campaign and labor allies, but fell short against an organized, well-funded Republican apparatus.

headline.seo: After Wisconsin Recall Defeat, Democrats Assess Their Operation
headline.main: Looking at Recall Vote as Drawing Lines for Fall
headline.print_headline: Looking at Recall Vote As Drawing Lines for Fall
